clinical_study.brief_title: Chidamide Combination With Lenalidomide in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Chidamide Combination With Lenalidomide in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma: an Open Label, Single Arm, Phase II Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this open label,single arm,phase Ⅱ clinical trail is to determine the safety and efficacy of Chidamide combination with lenalidomide for relapsed or refractory peripheral T-cell lymphoma.

detailed_description.textblock: Histone deacetylase(HDAC) inhibitor has been used in relapsed or refractory peripheral T-cell lymphoma.There are no international studies of Chidamide combination with lenalidomide for relapsed or refractory peripheral T-cell lymphoma. Therefore, this study intends to select the oral HDAC inhibitor Chidamide combined with lenalidomide for relapsed or refractory peripheral T-cell lymphoma, and explore its efficacy and safety.

clinical_study.condition: Relapsed or Refractory Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma

arm_group.description: Chidamide, 20 mg, twice per week; lenalidomide, 25 mg, d1-21, and rest for 7 days. one treatment cycle per 28 days.For patients with limited lesions and good drug response, local radiotherapy may be assessed by the investigator.

intervention.description: All patients enrolled in the study will accept Chidamide combination with lenalidomide regimen.
